Articles.Content:
How is Atmosphere Curve calculated? is there a formula?

(I'm talking about this:)

I think there was a mod which allowed you to create and export float curves in Unity. For simple atmosphereCurves, with only two keys like you have you don't really need it though. Key 0 is the specific impulse at 0 atmospheric pressure (so in Space), key 1 at full atmospheric pressure (at ground level). The higher the number you choose, the better is the ratio of thrust generated / fuel consumed.

8 minutes ago, Kartoffelkuchen said:

I think there was a mod which allowed you to create and export float curves in Unity. For simple atmosphereCurves, with only two keys like you have you don't really need it though. Key 0 is the specific impulse at 0 atmospheric pressure (so in Space), key 1 at full atmospheric pressure (at ground level). The higher the number you choose, the better is the ratio of thrust generated / fuel consumed.

the example that I chose here is the Ant engine, with a SL ISP of 80 and a VAC ISP of 315, which are shown in the 1st and 2nd keys

though, what does the 3rd key refer to?
I would also like a way to represent float curves with equations, and edit them.

The third key says at three atmospheres you ISP is 0.001

There are two additional numbers you can use to specify the slope - I think (grain of salt here) one is the incoming and one the out going slope.

Here's the Unity addon for float curves
